resources.string: 唯有當這個網址已經設置時，才可能使用搜尋鍵。在按下搜尋鍵時，這個網址會被用來和要搜尋的關鍵字組成實際的 URL。\n範例：https://example.com/search?q=
此應用程式的原始碼可在 https://github.com/sls1005/FundamentalBrowser 取得；以 MIT 授權釋出。
JavaScript 是甲骨文公司（Oracle Corporation）的商標或註冊商標。
顯示所使用的開放原始碼程式庫
載入網址時移除空格及換行符號
建議讓此選項保持開啟。
顯示用於將網址欄的輸入視為程式執行的按鍵
該按鍵僅在 JavaScript 為啟用狀態時有效。
如未啟用或未設定，則將使用預設值。\n\n警告：請注意，若使用高度客製化的 user agent 則可能導致私隱相關的問題。此類問題在 https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7231#section-9.7 中有所描述。
此項功能的實作牽涉到對這個瀏覽器的 user agent 進行變更，故可能導致私隱相關的問題。此類問題在 https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7231#section-9.7 中有所描述。\n若此選項未產生其應有的效果，請考慮使用自訂 user agent。關於自訂 user agent 的方式與詳情，請見下方。

如未啟用，則將使用預設值。若啟用了卻未設定，則會防止發送任何語言標籤。
若此選項未產生其應有的效果，請考慮變更此應用程式的語言。若您的裝置支援，則用於變更此應用程式語言的選項會出現在裝置的設定介面中。
網站可能忽略此資訊。

警告：請注意，若使用高度客製化的語言標籤則可能導致私隱相關的問題。此類問題在 https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7231#section-9.7 中有所描述。
執行指令碼前清空日誌
載入來源為其他應用程式的網址時，允許使用JavaScript
載入來自其他應用程式的網址之前先詢問
較高的權重代表較高優先級。具有較高優先級的語言會被認為是用戶偏好的語言。「預設」意為最優先。
重複該手勢以關閉視窗
在其他應用程式中開啟
在新視窗中開啟這個頁面
以純文字形式複製當前網址
以連結形式複製當前網址
錯誤：搜尋專用網址未設置。請於設定中設置之。
錯誤：找不到能處理此 URI 的應用程式。
錯誤：找不到本應用以外的應用程式來處理此 URI。

1. 這是一份通知書，而非法律文件。

2. 在使用本應用程式時，您所提供的部份資訊，或許包括，但不限於用戶自訂的所謂「用戶代理」（“user agent”）或用戶選擇的語言標籤（language tags），可能會被儲存在裝置中。上述這些資料可能會以未加密的方式被儲存。

3. 當用戶透過此應用程式造訪網站的時候，用戶提供的一些資訊（其中較重要的有自訂的用戶代理以及用戶選擇的語言標籤）可能會被送至該網站。依據所使用的協定，這些資料可能會以未加密的形式被傳送。

4. 本應用程式不會有意地在超出其作為瀏覽器所應當收集的範圍外收集您的資訊。另外，它永不會有意地協助隱藏您在網路上的身份，亦不會有意地阻止您在網路上隱藏身份。

5. 關於本應用程式如何收集以及使用資訊的更多詳情，請參閱其原始碼。
您想要手動設置語言標籤嗎？
您想要在其他應用程式中開啟這個網址嗎？
警告：您必須為此行為的任何後果承擔完全責任，因此請仔細檢視此 URL/URI ，尤其是當它以「intent:」開頭的時候。
警告：本應用程式無法顯示PDF檔案。
您想要載入「%1$s」這個頁面嗎？

The URL bar of this app is a little different from that of other browsers. It is still the place where the URL is displayed or edited, but now it is usually hidden and only shows up when the user needs it.

When you need to see the URL bar, tap on the ‘://’ symbol if it is present in the top bar, or use the ‘Show/hide URL bar’ or ‘Edit URL’ option from the menu that is opened by tapping the three-dot icon in the top bar. Tapping the ‘://’ symbol once again (if it is present) will close the URL bar if it is already opened.

The URL bar allows multiline editing, that is, text that is too long will be wrapped to the next line. This makes it easier to view and edit when the URL is very long.

There are several buttons at the bottom of the URL bar. Those are:

Go: load the web page corresponding to a given URL. Unlike the ‘Search’ button, this does not do search.

Search: search the web by using the text in the URL field as keywords. Only usable if the ‘search URL’ is set. Unlike the ‘Go’ button, this will not load a URL but… will search for it.

Copy: copy the text in the URL field, or the selected text in the URL field, if any.

Paste: paste the text to the URL field, either at the end of text or at the selected position if any text is selected.

Clear: clear the URL field, removing all text.

Restore: replace any text in the URL field with a previously loaded URL. This can also be used if the field is empty, in which case the previously loaded URL will still be restored, if any.

Decode: decode the URL if it is pct-encoded. See https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3986 for more details about pct-encoding.

Close: close the URL bar.
This is where the web page is displayed.\n

The log is a record of the web requests this app has made, including the requests for images, scripts, data (JSON) and other kinds of resources. It also contains the output of each script that has been run.

To open the log, use the ‘view log’ option from the option menu. The option is only available if there is anything in the log.

Each request-related entry consists of:
 (1) the method, e.g., GET.
 (2) if it is a redirection, a string that indicates so.
 (3) the URL associated with that request.

Using the back button of the device (or an equivalent gesture) will close the log.
To load a URL, paste it to the URL field and then tap ‘Go’\n.
ii. 在網絡上進行搜尋
To do search, firstly set the search URL in settings and enter the keyword, and then tap ‘Search’.\n
iii. 在網頁中進行搜尋
To do search in a web page, use the ‘search content’ option from the option menu (only available if any page is loaded).\n

To see the source code of a web page, add ‘view-source:’ to the start of the URL that points to it. For example: ‘view-source:https://example.com/index.html’. This usage is supported through the framework.

Alternatively, you can use the ‘view the source code of this page’ option hidden in the menu that is opened by tapping the three-dot icon and then tapping ‘more.’

To search in the source code, you may use the ‘search content’ option as if it were a normal web page.

To enter the console mode, input some code with the ‘javascript:’ prefix (e.g., ‘javascript:console.log(0);’) into the URL field while the log is already opened, and then tap ‘Go’. The result will be shown on the screen. You can also use the ‘Run’ button (enabled in settings) to do that.

Using a command prefixed with ‘javascript:’ in any other situation will cause it to be executed normally, as if loading a URL. The execution of such code, even in the console mode, is never handled by this app, but by the framework or system. This app only implemented the logic to display the log messages.
The ‘foreground logging’ feature gives you some meta-information about the page you are reading. The format of it is the same as that of a log entry. See above for more details.\n
vii. 使用這個應用程式作為通用意圖發送器及活動啟動器

By using some code that looks like ‘javascript:location.href="intent:#Intent;...;end"’, you can utilize this app as a generalized intent sender and activity launcher (by specifying ‘action’, ‘component’, etc. in the form of text), with the restriction that, the intent can only be sent to an app other than this application. For security concerns, this app will refuse to send such an intent if it detects its own package name in the URI or intent, in which case it can show an error message and might not log.

Intent scheme URIs are half-supported by this app. That is to say, they will usually be processed correctly, but this app usually doesn't check if a URI is an ‘intent:’ URI, except when trying to protect itself from intent-based attacks. (See https://www.mbsd.jp/Whitepaper/IntentScheme.pdf for information about this issue.)

Instead, `intent:` URIs will be treated as if they were URIs of unrecognized schemes (such as ‘abc://’), for any of which this app will ask the user whether to launch an intent, except in the specific situations mentioned above.
